body.p: I received your welcomed letter. I was very pleased to get it to tell the truth I was going to write you yesterday but I fell asleep instead. I’m sort dear.

Well, this last week was as boring as ever. If it hadn’t rained the day I wrote you we might have finished the job and have been home last weekend. But now it is all for the better because if I had of been home last weekend, I would not have been home again till the end of May. But now I will be home a week from the day you get this letter (Wed).
Sunday as usual was my most boring day. I slept till noon, got up + had

T bone steak for dinner. After dinner Tom and I went for a long walk back the roadway tracks to the river to see how the fishing was. Five minutes after we got back it started to rain. It was then that I was going to write you but I fell asleep. After supper I watched ed Sullivan and spent the rest of the night talking to the boys. As usual I worked all day to today.
Tonight after supper, Jerry found a couple of kids playing baseball Finally he tired them out and we played catch an hour or so. I had a shower and here I am. Sitting almost naked on my bed.
Oh if you are wondering about Friday night. We didn’t find Carol-
We tired five hotels. One hotel said they had been there but they did not have room or something like that. We never found them after.

Please excuse the writing. Thank you for phoning mother, you are a real dear. Oh what are you going to do with your girl friend, when I move into the apartment for the weekend. Seriously, I don’t know the apartment will cost a lot of extra money, won’t it. But easy come, easy go.
As for someone to talk to you could always write me a little more. I won’t complain, but I know how it is The DHO has a lot of good listeners.
For that bit about going out with you. You had better quit thinking. If you don’t know why I go out with you + if you don’t go out with me
for the same reason, we had better have a little chat when I get back. And what is this about this knowing bit + other girls. If you aren’t careful I might do that.
Oh did Pete phone up Vivian last weekend. Just wondering.
Well, dear if I don’t quit I’ll run out of paper. I will write as soon as I get to Pembroke.
Jerry was just in and said he loved you as much as I do, but I don’t believe that. He said he has heard enough about you to know. You will probably meet him next weekend I am home.
Honestly dear I do miss you. These two + three week stays are what I don’t like about this job. I’ll write in a couple days.
